home: A student-athlete at Westford Academy, passionate about running, learning, and building software.

projects.title: My website
projects.shortDescription: Managed to make this while taking 6 APs, being a dedicated XC-captain, and applying to colleges!

projects.title: Blackjack (Personal) & AI Neural Network (Tufts University)
projects.shortDescription: Designed and implemented a mostly full-featured Blackjack game in Java, and leveraged AI to implement a Race Car simulation using Reinforcement Learning to train an artificial neural network.

projects.title: Blackjack (Java)
description: Designed and implemented a mostly full-featured Blackjack game in Java.
Game includes an 8-deck shoe, card shuffling, hit/stay/double/split/surrender logic, betting, dealer play, win detection, and bankroll.
Playable only via desktop Java due to GUI requirements. (I still need to port to React.)
I purposefully only used AI for UI elements, as my goal was to practice more advanced object-oriented programming.

projects.title: Neural Network (Python)
description: As part of a summer program at Tufts, leveraged AI to implement a Race Car simulation using Reinforcement Learning to train an artificial neural network.

projects.title: Pac-Man in Scratch
projects.shortDescription: Implemented dot collection, 2 ghost enemies, level transitions, 3 levels, scoring, custom board with my initials, and a secret compartment in the 3rd level.

projects.title: Pac-Man (MIT Scratch)

description: Recreated the classic Pac-Man arcade game in MIT Scratch.

projects.title: Bio Lab
projects.shortDescription: In one study, I used a drone and bluetooth thermometer to study the effect of elevation on air temperature. In another, I studied an application of Laminar Flow: the effect of distance from shore on surface current.

projects.title: AP Biology Lab Notebook
description: Used a drone and bluetooth thermometer to study the effect of elevation on air temperature.

projects.title: AP Biology Lab Notebook
description: Studied an application of Laminar Flow: the effect of distance from shore on surface current.

projects.title: Bio Lab
projects.shortDescription: Wrote an image processing program in C# to detect tar spots in leaves and calculate its effect on chlorophyll concentration of surrounding areas.

projects.title: AP Biology Lab Notebook
description: Scanned pages from my AP Bio lab notebook, where I wrote a program to help me study the effect of tar spot has on the chlorophyll concentration of leaves.
